intro: Soroseris hookeriana, commonly known as Hooker's soroseris, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are often hairy and grayish in appearance, and the flowers bloom in shades of yellow and white. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
